moves.4. Nbd2: 4. c4 Is the only chance for an advantage.
moves.4... O-O 5. e4 d5: Suddenly we are in a French Defense up a tempo.
moves.8. c3: 8. O-O Nc6 (8... cxd4 9. Nb3) 9. Re1 cxd4 10. Nb3 Qc7 =
moves.8... Nc6: 8. ... cxd4 transposes to this.  Also good are a5, f6, b6 and Qc7.
moves.9. O-O cxd4:
9... Qb6 10. dxc5 Nxc5 11. Bc2 is not quite as good.
9... f6 is fine and probably transposes.
moves.10. cxd4: Position seems rather dull to me.  Black has to do something to make it more interesting ...
moves.15. Nbd4 a4: With the idea of Nxf3, Nxf3 and a3.  Nxf3 and Re8 are about as good.
moves.20. Re1 Nxd4 21. Nxd4 Qc5:
The only move with a slight advantage.

Now 22. Nf3  Survives just fine.
moves.22. Nb5: White resigned here.  Maybe he saw ...
moves.22... Qxf2+ 23. Kxf2: 23. Kh1 Bd7 [Prepares Rae8.] 24. Bxc4 dxc4 25. Rf3 Qxf3 26. gxf3 (26. Qxf3 Bh4) 26... Bxb5 [ Amazingly, Black's rooks and bishops will control the whole board.] 27. Kg2 Bc6 28. Rf1 c3 29. Kg3 Ra5 30. Qd3 g6 31. h4 Rd8 32. Qc2 Rd4 33. h5 Rxh5 34. Qxc3 Be5+ 35. f4 Rg5+ 36. Kh2 Rxf4 37. Qxe5+ Rxe5 38. Bxf4 Rd5
